page.title: 10LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our marked area consisted of many fields,the majority of which were unsown grasslands,fenced and generally used for grazing.There was a large number of open fields,which often ran up the side of hills and had been sown and fertilized with the intention of being used as silage or hay.We also noted several fields which consisted of crops,other than grass,such as wheat and barley.In the far corner of our area there was a significant ammount of woodland,dominated by conifers. Running round many of the fields were small brooks,and in some fields, especially grazing fields,there were artifical ponds from which the animals drank,even though many of them were heavily polluted.
